title: Selecting and Applying Instructional Design Models for Workplace-Based Mathematics Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Mathematical Operations and Essential Calculation Skills for Administrative Tasks
context.additional_context: Course for office/administrative professionals to improve practical mathematical skills required for job performance. Requires selecting an instructional design model compatible with the DACUM procedure

learning_goals: Learners can derive at least three essential mathematical competencies required for administrative management through DACUM-based job task analysis
Learners can successfully implement mathematical models to solve real-world work scenarios at least twice through project-based assessment
Learners can develop self-directed learning plans in an LMS environment and achieve over 80% completion rates
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
